tika.dc.description:
Review

"If your book is ever published, it will be a very important book--VERY important!" He requested not to be named, so he wouldn't be professionally ostracized. -- One of the world's leading Hitler/Holocaust scholars

From the Publisher

For SuperiorBooks.com, the opportunity to publish Why the Holocaust Happened: Its Religious Cause and Scholarly Cover-Up is a rare honor. Seldom does a work of non-fiction so shake the accepted underpinnings of public thinking about a major historical event, in this case, the Holocaust. When we read the book, we at first found the unthinkable to be thinkable; then believable and, finally, we accepted its findings.

WHY the Holocaust Happened should have been and will yet become a mainstream work, but the wheels of the publishing industry grind powerfully slow; some kinds of controversy are not, at first, welcome; some subjects are taboo. This is what gave SuperiorBooks.com its present role as publisher of this book.

We were extremely impressed with the thorough documentation of Eric Zuesse's findings, based on his years of research into the private notes, letters and conversations that so incisively define the real Adolf Hitler. In addition, the author, as winner of the H. L. Mencken Award for "The Best Investigative Reporting of the Year" brings the kind of credentials to his work that argue strongly for its acceptance.

For the reading public, for institutions and for scholars, alike, WHY the Holocaust Happened is a wake-up call, a call for all responsible people to acknowledge the religious motivation for the Holocaust and to use that awareness in the interests of assuring that it never happens again.
